title: Georgia lawmakers debate plan to eliminate state income tax | Lawmakers 2026
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia lawmakers' debate on a plan to eliminate the state income tax:

## Overview
The Georgia Senate Special Committee on the Elimination of Georgia's Income Tax has been gathering input and developing a proposal to significantly reduce or eliminate the state income tax. The discussion centers around the details and tradeoffs of such a plan.

## Key Actions
No specific bills or legislative actions were mentioned.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected.

## Notable Moments
- Republican Senator Blake Tillerie and Democratic Senator Nan Orrok, both members of the special committee, discussed the committee's proposals and their differing perspectives.
- The proposals aim to eliminate income tax on the first $50,000 for individuals and $100,000 for joint filers, while reducing rates for other taxpayers.
- Debate centered on the impact on the state budget, with concerns raised about funding critical services versus providing broad tax relief.

## Votes
No recorded votes mentioned.

## Attendance
No quorum notes provided.

## Adjournment
No adjournment or next session date provided.
